Text: Sweet, thanks. I got the 4th edition a long time ago, but I need the 5th now that I'm actually taking a cal class. I'm glad i won't have to waste 100$+ juste because they switch the problems so the old books become obsoloete :)

Can someone please reseed this?  Thanks!

This thing is absolutely VITAL to have. I like how I can't find any place that sells it, and most textbook search engines don't show this because it's a teaching guide.

Thank you for making my life easier!

There is a torrent on IsoHunt that has the full book--1300 pages in the PDF, (though I don't have my physical book on me, so I can't be sure that's everything). It has chapter indexes listing 17 chapters and the appendix, so it seems quite complete. The only draw back is that it's black and white, so the nice color pictures that help in 3-dimensional calculus aren't as clear. Still, at 20MB, it's much more portable than the real book.

Please let me know if anyone has the solution manual for the same book but edition six:

Stewart - Calculus - Early Transcendentals 6e HQ (Thomson, 2008)
